name: PrayStation year 2 CDROM / 2001
description:
I have found a very limit number of PrayStation year 2 CDROMs in storage. If you never had a chance to pick up this art object back in 2001... today's your lucky day.

Each box is signed with an invader and skull drawing.

--

PrayStation year 2 cdrom, my hard drive. A joint project between IdN magazine in Hong Kong and myself.

This hopefully will strike against most of our notions about how a cdrom should behave. Usually we acquire and view media on cdrom in a traditional manner, by launching an executable and letting it take over our desktops. This cdrom is the exact opposite. Its purpose is for the viewer to sift through the 397 folders, exploring the 3,637 files which total 462 megs of data.

It is everything I collected over the past year, which made PrayStation year 2 what it was. All original source files, art files, text files, accidents, epiphanies, etc.

some data may even be broken - as it attempts to connect with the PrayStation server. Nothing was altered. It is there for you to explore how things were built and how things talked to each other.

In March 2000, my very first open-sourced flash file hit PrayStation, and it's been pure chaos ever since. The notion of needing to give something away in order to receive something new has never hit home harder than it has in the past year. A community of people have banded together - hoping to help build and nurture the new media experience.

I hope you enjoy this booklet and cdrom - it's truly a glimpse into process, successes, failures, and accidents.

name: the Triangle Grid, Teal
description:
Specifications :


Printed on the HP Designjet Z3100 Photo Printer using HP Vivera pigment inks which resist fading for over 200 years. (just in case you happen to be immortal) printed on Enhanced Matte Paper, 192 gsm, 10.3 mil

Dimensions :


24 x 17 in - 60.96 x 43.18 cm

Description :


The Triangle Grid was created from a series of workshops files created at the Anderson Ranch Art Complex in Snowmass Colorado. Using a grid system in Processing with SVG, 6 triangle themed vector assets were randomly modified mathematically perfect, so that lines would always intersect with other lines in the system.

Edition :


This poster is NOT signed and NOT part of an edition.

name: Matika 01
description:
Specifications :


Printed on the HP Designjet Z3100 Photo Printer using HP Vivera pigment inks which resist fading for over 200 years. (just in case you happen to be immortal) printed on Enhanced Matte Paper, 192 gsm, 10.3 mil

Dimensions :


18.672 x 24 in - 47.43 x 60.96 cm

Description :


Commissioned by Carlos Luna James for Matika Magazine in Mexico. This poster uses several drawn assets from my map collections. After being placed within a generative system, a program is able to generate an infinite amount of layouts using strict rules on composition and color.

Edition :


This poster is NOT signed and NOT part of an edition.

name: Random Assistant 01
description:
Specifications :


Printed on the HP Designjet Z3100 Photo Printer using HP Vivera pigment inks which resist fading for over 200 years. (just in case you happen to be immortal) printed on Enhanced Matte Paper, 192 gsm, 10.3 mil

Dimensions :


64.364 x 24 in - 163.48 x 60.96 cm YEAH... over 5 feet x 2 feet

Description :


Showcased in exhibitions in Rovereto, Italy and Lisbon, Portugal... "Random Assistant" removed a process from the generative programs I write and placed the fate of the work in the hands of the public. In this case, the color was removed and the public was invited to color the work using chalk and water, which created a wash of pigment like watercolor. Please note that this work is $60 because of the size of the work... it's looooooong. Also note that this work has no top or bottom and can be hung horizontally or vertically. My true hope is that this poster is worked on by groups of people... it's about collaboration. Please photograph and submit your remixed / colored posters, and I'll be sure to post them here.

Edition :


This poster is NOT signed and NOT part of an edition.

name: BMW Z4 / blue / DIY
description:
Specifications :


Printed on the HP Designjet Z3100 Photo Printer using HP Vivera pigment inks which resist fading for over 200 years. (just in case you happen to be immortal) printed on Enhanced Matte Paper, 192 gsm, 10.3 mil

Dimensions :


24 x 44 in - 60.96 x 111.76 cm

Description :


Commissioned by BMW for the BMW Z4 Coupé. A limited edition of 500 prints were commissioned using a unique generative process to create 500 completely unique prints. This poster showcases one of the outputs from the collection to be offered outside of the limited edition, as part of the DIY series. view project on BMW's website view documentary film, shot by Hillman Curtis

name: ORIGINAL / istanbul 01
description:
Specifications :


Drawn on Strathmore Bristol smooth surface paper / acid free / heavy weight.

Dimensions :
